Title: Caps the amount of taxes a senior has to pay on his or her real property at the amount such individual paid in the year in which he or she turned 65
Summary: Caps the amount of taxes a senior has to pay on his or her real property at the amount such individual paid in the year in which he or she turned 65; provides that the individual claiming the limitation must be the owner of the property and must reside in the property for at least seventy-five percent of the year.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the limitation of taxation on certain seniors
